extent.charseq: LAW OFFICE OF W. MICHAEL JACOBS
the guy who shoulda known better
the day before she is to be released
My girlfriend was on the run from probation in Fla when she got herself in trouble here in Az. which apparantly, true to her habits, she tried to avoid by not showing up for court
They let her serve her time in AZ, then they come and get her to serve her time in FL
She will probably have to serve out her sentence in FL, AND if she has not already served all her time in AZ, they will then ship her back there to do THAT time

Az troubles again in 2004, she serves 6 months , then the day before she is to be released to do 5 yrs probation her in az, fla shows up and takes her to fla faceing her original 1999 charges which are still open (she failed miserably at probation) I think they want to give her 3 years
the day before she is to be released

All the FL prosecutors have to do is ask, and the AZ jailers will pack her up in a van or a plane and ship her back to FL for trial on the FTA charge and probably to commence her serving time under the suspended sentence that went along with her original probation
They let her serve her time in AZ, then they come and get her to serve her time in FL
She will probably have to serve out her sentence in FL, AND if she has not already served all her time in AZ, they will then ship her back there to do THAT time
Waitaminit, you said she DOES have a public defender

The waiver of extradition that she signed simply means that if she skips out and goes to another state, she can't contest the right of the original court to have her hauled back to its jurisdiction, and that the court won't have to initiate the time-consuming process of extraditing her

All the FL prosecutors have to do is ask, and the AZ jailers will pack her up in a van or a plane and ship her back to FL for trial on the FTA charge and probably to commence her serving time under the suspended sentence that went along with her original probation

All the FL prosecutors have to do is ask, and the AZ jailers will pack her up in a van or a plane and ship her back to FL for trial on the FTA charge and probably to commence her serving time under the suspended sentence that went along with her original probation
It's good for the STATE, not for the convict. It lets them skip some of the legal procedures she would otherwise be entitled to, in order to ship her from one state to another
It's good for the STATE, not for the convict. It lets them skip some of the legal procedures she would otherwise be entitled to, in order to ship her from one state to another
You're complaining that YOU can't get an atty
My girlfriend was on the run from probation in Fla when she got herself in trouble here in Az

extent.charseq: your nose at the court often enough, and they will bring all sorts of crap down on your head, re-instituting the original suspended sentences

ldc_scope.charseq: Thumb your nose at the court often enough, and they will bring all sorts of crap down on your head, re-instituting the original suspended sentences and possibly adding on for the FTA

ldc_scope.charseq: It lets them skip some of the legal procedures she would otherwise be entitled to, in order to ship her from one state to another

extent.charseq: they were entitled to demand that waiver as a condition of probation; if she had not agreed to voluntarily waive that right, they probably would have just thrown her in jail for the 3 year sentence

ldc_scope.charseq: But they were entitled to demand that waiver as a condition of probation; if she had not agreed to voluntarily waive that right, they probably would have just thrown her in jail for the 3 year sentence the first time around and she wouldn't have been given the chance to go straight during probation and avoid jail altogether
